greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n consists of n followed by the numbers n through 2n-2.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: T:=proc(n,k) if n<k then 0 elif k=1 then n else n+k-2 end if end proc: for n to 10 do seq(T(n,k),k=1..n) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form - _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 24 2007
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 27 2007
ext: Corrected and extended by _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 18 2013
